comments:
In 1889 the part of the parish of Abergele in Rhyl Urban District 
    became part of Flintshire. In 1894 this area became a separate unnamed parish and the remaining part of Abergele was abolished and divided between the parishes 
    of Abergele Urban and Abergele Rural.

Abolished 1894 to become the separate parishes of Henllan Urban 
    and Henllan Rural.

Abolished 1.4.1935 and divided between the parishes of Abergele 
    Urban, Llandrillo yn Rhôs and Betws yn Rhôs. See also Table 2, note (a).
Abolished 1.4.1934 and added to the parish of Prestatyn.

On 1.10.1895 the part Denbighshire  
    became the  parish of Cefn, so that thereafter St. Asaph was entirely 
    in Flintshire. See also Table 2, note (d).

Abolished 1.4.1935 and divided between the parishes of Abergele 
    Rural and Abergele Rural.
